0.name: polymorphism
0.description: in programming languages and type theory, accessing different types using a common interface

2.name: weak typing
2.description: the opposite of strong typing discipline

3.name: structural type system
3.description: major class of type system, in which type compatibility and equivalence are determined by the type's actual structure or definition, and not by other characteristics such as its name or place of declaration

4.name: duck typing
4.description: a style of dynamic typing in object oriented programming

5.name: partial inference typing
5.description: a style of dynamic typing in object-oriented programming

7.name: static typing
7.description: type system paradigm where all type checking is done at compile time

8.name: nominative typing
8.description: major class of type system, in which compatibility and equivalence of data types is determined by explicit declarations and/or the name of the types

10.name: strong typing
10.description: specificity of a programming language's syntax when manipulating types of data

11.name: inference typing
11.description: automatic detection of the data type of an expression in a programming language

12.name: dynamic typing
12.description: a style of dynamic typing in object oriented programming
